definition: bad habits/to get into bad habits through long custom
one's habits change with long custom

sentences.english: It is the custom here to take a cold shower every evening in summer.
sentences.chinese: 在夏天每天傍晚洗冷水浴是這裏的習俗。

sentences.english: According to the story, the practice of hanging up stockings is connected with St. Nicholas.
sentences.chinese: 據傳，懸掛襪子的習俗與聖尼古拉有關。

sentences.english: It turned out that a number of tribes in ancient China, there is looting marriage customs.
sentences.chinese: 原來，在古代中國的一些部落，有搶婚的習俗。

sentences.english: Gardens in Japan, though of Chinese parentage, have more conventions and less complexity in lay-out than the Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 日本園林，雖然源於中國，佈局的習俗化大於複雜化。

sentences.english: This is only done as an offering at Japanese funerals.
sentences.chinese: 這種行爲只會在日本葬禮作爲供奉先人的習俗進行。

sentences.english: Follow the customs of the new country you are in, or keep your own customs?
sentences.chinese: 入鄉隨俗還是保留自己國家的習俗？

sentences.english: Babysitting is a rite of passage for many girls in junior high school.
sentences.chinese: 看護兒童是很多在初中的女孩經歷的習俗。

sentences.english: By convention, the bride's father gives her away at her wedding.
sentences.chinese: 按照習俗，新娘的父親在她的婚禮上把她交出去。

sentences.english: In other parts of China, tea-drinking rules are different from that of gongfu tea.
sentences.chinese: 其實，大部分地區的飲茶習俗都與閩南的工夫茶不同。

sentences.english: In keeping with tradition, the Pope then delivered Christmas greetings in 65 languages.
sentences.chinese: 根據傳統習俗，教皇使用65種語言表達了聖誕祝福。

sentences.english: Still, I remained enamored of religion itself as an institution.
sentences.chinese: 儘管如此，我仍然將宗教看作一種習俗來迷戀。

sentences.english: Part of the lantern festival tradition involves a game to guess riddles attached to the lanterns.
sentences.chinese: 元宵節傳統習俗中還有一部分是關於猜燈謎的遊戲。

sentences.english: It's become a Chinese custom for many familes to watch the CCTV New Year Gala while having their dinner.
sentences.chinese: 喫年夜飯看春晚已經成爲很多中國家庭的習俗。

sentences.english: This pre-wedding tradition is a symbol of protection and shelter for the new bride.
sentences.chinese: 這一婚前習俗象徵對新娘的保護。

sentences.english: The custom has been held on nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 這個習俗一直流傳到現在。

sentences.english: The custom began during the Second World War.
sentences.chinese: 這種習俗始於第二次世界大戰期間。

definition: among the people/popular/folk/non-governmental/involving people rather than governments
to celebrate the Chinese New Year
Dragon Boat Festival (5th day of the 5th lunar month)
Lantern Festival, the final event of the Spring Festival 春節|春节, on 15th of first month of the lunar calendar
